metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12294 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebCore/platform/graphics/texmap/TextureMapperLayer.cpp in WebKit, as used in WebKitGTK+ prior to version 2.20.2, is vulnerable to a use after free for a WebCore::TextureMapperLayer object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12294` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
